attributes.action: Give Captain Tom Moore a knighthood for services to the NHS
attributes.additional_details:
Already a decorated WWII veteran, now in his 100th year, Captain Tom Moore set out to raise £1,000 for the NHS.

To do so, he has continually walked around his garden (with this help of a walking aid), he has raised phenomenal amounts of money for the NHS, showing unbelievable levels of pride for our NHS as well as compassion for people who are fighting to keep out nation healthy and save lives.

Recognising his determination and love for the NHS and fellow man should not go unrecognised.
attributes.background: HM Government should awarding a Captain Tom Moore a KBE.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because it asks for someone to be nominated for an honour. 

Members of the public can nominate people for honours directly. You can find out how to nominate someone for an honour here:

https://www.gov.uk/honours
